revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Teleadapt |model=Deskpoint Wireless |revision=v1 (TA-6900) |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=11/09/2006 |manuf_country=China |manuf=Interepoch |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point |fcc_id=PRL-TA6900 |ic_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=2 |pwr_conn=non-standard |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Samsung |cpu1_model=S3C2510A |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand=EtronTech |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=Mini PCI |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num=1 |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=PESI WM233L |wi1_module_if=Mini PCI |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT2561 |wi1_chip2_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip2_model=RT2527 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=IC+ |eth_chip2_model=IP101A |eth_chip3_brand=IC+ |eth_chip3_model=IP101A |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:09:92 |oui_eth=00:09:92 }} '''DeskPoint Wireless Version 1.0'''
The device is marketed towards usage in hotels as an in-room access point.
"WL-APE06-03" is silkscreened on the main board in the FCC photos. :"WM233L" and "41713-84104-B" is silkscreened on the wireless module.. indicating it is (likely) a '''PESI''' WM233L. A MAC label affixed to the card in the internal photos has an 00:0E:8E ('''SparkLAN''') OUI.
The CPU used is presumed to be a S3C2510A. The two 10/100 PHYs appear to be IP101As..
The default SSID may be '''wireless''' (.. it is the value in the rather generic FCC ''manual'') or '''deskpoint''' (used by the v2).
